title: How to Make a Magnetic Induction Battery Charger

steps.headline: Get some rechargeable batteries.
steps.description: Non rechargeable batteries will explode if charged.

steps.headline: Go to an electronics hobby store and buy the following items:
steps.description: Battery holder for the type you wish to charge Electrical Wiring, preferable uninsulated, but if it isn't you need to strip the insulation off.

steps.headline: Now you will need to acquire these mechanical parts.
steps.description:
A hand crank
Something to mount the hand crank to, but make sure it can still rotate. A bar magnet

steps.headline: Next you need to create a tube of wiring around the bar magnet.
steps.description: Make sure the bar magnet can rotate within the wire, but the wire is not more than 1 and inch from the magnet. Remember the magnet will be rotating horizontally, not vertically.

steps.headline: Connect the two free ends of the wiring to the battery holder.
Take a screw that the magnet wants to stick to and attach it to the hand crank.
Attach the magnet, using its own magnetism, to the screw.
steps.description: You may need two screws, one for each pole of the magnet.

steps.headline: Attach the crank onto the support structure so it can be cranked.
Place and secure the wire tube around the bar magnet.
Crank the handle to charge your battery.
